Package ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.substringfinder

Class AbstractSubstringFinder

java.lang.Object
ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.substringfinder.AbstractSubstringFinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
SubstringMatchFinder
Direct Known Subclasses:
KnuthMorrisPrattSubstringFinder, NaiveSubstringFinder, TwoWaySubstringFinder
public abstract class AbstractSubstringFinder extends Object implements SubstringMatchFinder
A template for a class implementing SubstringMatchFinder interface.

Provides protected needle and haystack fields, initialized by AbstractSubstringFinder(InputStream, String) constructor. First one is an array of chars to find in text, being converted from a String. Second one is an instance of CharSlicer class, which gives a programmer functionality of a sliding window over the supplied text.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractSubstringFinder

      public AbstractSubstringFinder(InputStream source, String needleString) throws IOException
      Constructs a new instance of AbstractSubstringFinder.
      Parameters:
      source - a stream containing UTF-8-encoded text
      needleString - a string to find in a text provided by source.
      Throws:
      IOException - if source is unavailable
      InputMismatchException - if a needleString is longer than a text supplied by a source
      See Also:
      • CharSlicer

      public abstract List<Integer> find() throws IOException
      Proceeds a search of a substring in a supplied text. May be called only once.
      Specified by:
      find in interface SubstringMatchFinder
      Returns:
      a list of indices where the substring was found
      Throws:
      IOException - if a stream is unavailable
